dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: ...just, like, completely pull out of that? I mean, what even is Covax, exactly? Oh, right, okay. So, um, Covax is basically this big international initiative, co-led by the World Health Organization, um, with the goal to get two billion doses of potential COVID shots by late 2021 and, you know, distribute them worldwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...just, like, completely pull out of that? I mean, what even is Covax, exactly? Oh, right, okay. So, um, Covax is basically this big international initiative, co-led by the World Health Organization, um, with the goal to get two billion doses of potential COVID shots by late twenty twenty one and, you know, distribute them worldwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covax is co-led by the World Health Organization, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations and Gavi, which aims to purchase 2 billion doses of potential Covid-19 shots from several vaccine makers by the end of 2021 and distribute them worldwide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So the U.S. just, like, isn't joining that? Like, at all?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the U.S. just, like, isn't joining that? Like, at all?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Host_A, that's pretty much it. They announced Tuesday they wouldn't join, citing concerns over the WHO's alleged bias and, uh, the influence of China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Host_A, that's pretty much it. They announced Tuesday they wouldn't join, citing concerns over the W H O's alleged bias and, uh, the influence of China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. announced Tuesday that it would not join an international coalition to find and distribute a Covid-19 vaccine worldwide due to the group's association with the World Health Organization... we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, why China? And the WHO? I thought they were, like, trying to help.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, why China? And the W H O? I thought they were, like, trying to help.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the White House spokesman, Judd Deere, said they have credible intelligence that the WHO was intentionally misleading the public, and, um, they see the organization as being too influenced by China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the White House spokesman, Judd Deere, said they have credible intelligence that the W H O was intentionally misleading the public, and, um, they see the organization as being too influenced by China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: we will not be constrained by multilateral organizations influenced by the corrupt World Health Organization and China, said Judd Deere, a spokesman for the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, is that, like, why Trump pulled funding earlier, too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, is that, like, why Trump pulled funding earlier, too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He, uh, he initially praised China and the WHO, but then, like, sharply reversed course. Called the WHO "China-centric," froze U.S. funding back in April, and then, uh, signaled intent to withdraw in July.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He, uh, he initially praised China and the W H O, but then, like, sharply reversed course. Called the W H O China-centric, froze U.S. funding back in April, and then, uh, signaled intent to withdraw in July.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After initially praising both China and the WHO at the pandemic's outset, President Donald Trump sharply reversed course. In early April, Trump blasted the World Health Organization, saying they called it wrong on the virus, that the WHO was very China-centric in its approach, and froze U.S. funding to the organization. In July, the administration sent a letter signaling its intent to withdraw from the WHO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So it's not, like, a new thing. But, um, why would the U.S. not want to be part of, like, a global effort for a vaccine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So it's not, like, a new thing. But, um, why would the U.S. not want to be part of, like, a global effort for a vaccine?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the Washington Post reported that Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar actually had interest, but there was, um, resistance within the government. And, you know, a belief that the U.S. has enough vaccine candidates in trials to kind of, like, go it alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the Washington Post reported that Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar actually had interest, but there was, um, resistance within the government. And, you know, a belief that the U.S. has enough vaccine candidates in trials to kind of, like, go it alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Washington Post, Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar had interest in exploring some type of role in Covax but there was resistance in some corners of the government and a belief that the U.S. has enough coronavirus vaccine candidates in advanced clinical trials that it can go it alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Go it alone? But isn't that, like, vaccine nationalism? I feel like I heard that term somewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Go it alone? But isn't that, like, vaccine nationalism? I feel like I heard that term somewhere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You totally did. The WHO, uh, has explicitly warned against vaccine nationalism, with their chief saying for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together because, you know, economies are intertwined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You totally did. The W H O, uh, has explicitly warned against vaccine nationalism, with their chief saying for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together because, you know, economies are intertwined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The World Health Organization has warned against vaccine nationalism, with WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus stating, for the world to recover faster, it has to recover together, because it's a globalized world: the economies are intertwined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But, like, the U.S. is just, um, ignoring that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, like, the U.S. is just, um, ignoring that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for now. And, uh, it's pretty controversial. Other allies, like the EU and Germany, they've actually contributed to Covax.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for now. And, uh, it's pretty controversial. Other allies, like the E U and Germany, they've actually contributed to Covax.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, the European Commission confirmed it would contribute 400 million euros ($478 million) to the initiative, and the WHO said Germany had joined the pact as well.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So this is, like, a really big deal, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this is, like, a really big deal, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. Suerie Moon, from the Global Health Center, she called it a "real blow" and said the behavior of countries on vaccines will have, like, political repercussions way beyond public health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. Suerie Moon, from the Global Health Center, she called it a real blow and said the behavior of countries on vaccines will have, like, political repercussions way beyond public health.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the U.S. says it is not going to participate in any sort of multilateral effort to secure vaccines, it's a real blow, said Suerie Moon, co-director of the Global Health Center at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva. The behavior of countries when it comes to vaccines in this pandemic will have political repercussions beyond public health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yikes. So, um, kind of a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yikes. So, um, kind of a mess.
